description: From Middle English bischilden, from Old English besċyldian, besċieldian (“to shield, defend”); equivalent to be- +‎ shield.

verbs.description: beshield (third-person singular simple present beshields, present participle beshielding, simple past and past participle beshielded)

entries.meaning: (transitive, reflexive, archaic) To shield around or about; protect; defend.
examples: Of course I was frightened — frightened of being struck, or beshamed, during the next tone-show — so cast about for someone to beshield me.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To provide or outfit with a shield.
examples: Our bearers now began to call themselves Natal Kafirs, fearing to say they were Zulus before the young Amaswazi warriors, beplumed, beshielded, bespeared, perched about here and there in picturesque unconsciousness of their picturesqueness.
